result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquelle L Miller in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  
Student Intern Caroline Pelligrini supervised by Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense  request a plea date. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 13 pages) commencing 06-24-2022 by SANDRA M. KANDZIORA.

Defendant Marquelle L Miller in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Shorewood Sgt. C. Smith   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM028443  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/04/2022 sa

Defendant Marquelle L Miller not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kentajah C. (owner of Hyundai Elantra);  Calli N. (owner of Hyundai SUV)
Lori S. (owner of car struck during flight)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Marquelle L Miller in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Marquelle L Miller in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquelle L Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
